Interface Item

All Known Implementing Classes:
Armor, Arrow, Curse, Gold, MagicItem, ManaStone, MeleeWeapon, RangeWeapon, Shield
public sealed interface Item permits RangeWeapon, Arrow, MeleeWeapon, Armor, Shield, ManaStone, MagicItem, Gold, Curse
Represents a generic item that can be placed in the hero's backpack and optionally used in combat. All items define their shape, rarity, price, and detailed description.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    details()
    Returns a textual description of this item, explaining its behavior.
    String
    name()
    Returns the full display name of this item.
    List<Position>
    pos()
    Returns the relative grid positions occupied by this item.
    int
    price()
    Returns the price of this item when bought or sold.
    Rarity
    rarity()
    Returns the rarity of this item.
    default boolean
    rotatable()
    Indicates whether this item can be rotated in the backpack.
    String
    toString()
    Returns a short string representation used for compact display (e.g., in the backpack grid).
    boolean
    use(Heros heros, Ennemi target)
    Attempts to use this item during combat.

  • Method Details

    • price

      int price()
      Returns the price of this item when bought or sold.
      Returns:
      the item's price (must be non-negative)

    • toString

      String toString()
      Returns a short string representation used for compact display (e.g., in the backpack grid).
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a short identifier string

    • pos

      List<Position> pos()
      Returns the relative grid positions occupied by this item. The origin (0,0) corresponds to the top-left pivot point.
      Returns:
      a list of relative positions describing the itemâ€™s shape

      Returns the full display name of this item.

      Rarity rarity()
      Returns the rarity of this item.
      Returns:
      the item rarity

    • use

      boolean use(Heros heros, Ennemi target)
      Attempts to use this item during combat.
      Parameters:
      target - the targeted enemy (may be null for defensive items)
      hero - the hero using the item
      Returns:
      true if the item was successfully used, false otherwise

    • rotatable

      default boolean rotatable()
      Indicates whether this item can be rotated in the backpack.
      Returns:
      true if the item can rotate, false otherwise
